description: China’s tariffs on canola are the “most immediate threat” to western Canada’s economy, Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe said, even as the US threatens to raise import taxes against a wide range of Canadian goods.
title: Saskatchewan Urges Carney to Deal With Threat of Chinese Tariffs

description: The Trump administration took a tentative step back into the real estate market on Friday, beginning the process to list eight properties for possible sale after scuttling a far more ambitious plan to shrink the federal portfolio earlier this month.
title: Trump Agency Lists Buildings for Sale After Real Estate Reversal

description: A federal judge admonished a Justice Department lawyer for failing to obey his oral order last weekend to have the US government halt deportation flights of alleged Venezuelan gang members who ended up in a prison in El Salvador.
title: Judge Scolds DOJ Lawyer Over Venezuelan Deportation Order

description: The Trump administration must continue to comply with a Maryland judge’s order to temporarily reinstate almost 25,000 fired employees at 18 US agencies for at least another week, a federal appeals court held.
title: Court Rules to Keep 25,000 Fired Federal Workers in Jobs for Now

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Musk’s Presence Intrudes Even When He’s Not in the Room

description: A Maryland federal judge pushed back on speculation that her court order restricting Social Security Administration data access for Elon Musk and his cost-cutting team may threaten benefit payments by forcing much of the agency’s operations to shut down.
title: DOGE Ruling Shouldn’t Stop Social Security Payouts, Judge Says

description: Peru’s congress fired the nation’s minister in charge of police on Friday, days after the murder of a popular singer once again raised alarm about a rise in deadly extortion rackets.
title: Peru’s Congress Fires Police Czar as Outrage Over Crime Rises

description: President Donald Trump’s closest allies in Congress are eager to punish the federal judges standing in the way of his second-term agenda.
title: Trump Wants Judges Impeached. Can That Happen?

description: The Biden administration secretly permitted Chevron Corp. to pay hundreds of millions of dollars to the Venezuelan government despite a license that explicitly prohibited such disbursements, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Biden’s Secret Deal Allowed Chevron to Pay Venezuela Millions

description: The US government banned former Argentina President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner and her immediate family members from entering the country due to her corruption conviction, a move bound to polarize the country’s midterm elections later this year.
title: US Bars Argentina’s Kirchner From Entry Due to Graft Conviction

description: The UK’s limited access to the European Union’s new €150 billion ($162 billion) weapons fund has raised concern in London that Prime Minister Keir Starmer won’t be able to secure a breakthrough defense pact with Brussels by May.
title: UK Hopes of Quick EU Defense Deal Fade on Weapons Fund Access

description: Chile center-right presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei praised Argentina’s austerity drive on Friday, as public spending emerges as a top issue in this year’s election.
title: Chile Presidential Candidate Matthei Lauds Argentina Budget Cuts

description: About 500 staffers at the Securities & Exchange Commission have agreed to leave the agency in response to its $50,000 buyout and deferred-resignation offers, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.
title: SEC to Lose About 500 Staffers to Buyout, Resignation Offers

description: Elon Musk visited the the Pentagon on Friday for a conversation about cost-cutting and innovation, but President Donald Trump denied there were ever plans for him to get a top-secret briefing on China as news reports had claimed.
title: Elon Musk Visits Pentagon But Trump Denies He Got China Briefing

description: A key US House committee is expected to advance landmark stablecoin legislation, a priority of President Donald Trump and the crypto industry, according to two people familiar with the plans.
title: Stablecoin Bill on Track to Advance in House Committee

description: The US Justice Department is seeking to intervene on behalf of President Donald Trump in the long-running civil lawsuits accusing him of being personally liable for the violence and disruption at the US Capitol during the Jan. 6, 2021, attack.
title: DOJ Moves to Take Over Trump Defense Against Jan. 6 Lawsuits

description: Polish prosecutors charged Mariusz Blaszczak, a defense minister in the previous nationalist government, for disclosing parts of a classified military plan ahead of a parliamentary election in 2023.
title: Poland Charges Former Minister for Revealing Secret Defense Plan

description: France wants the European Union to consider deploying its most powerful retaliatory measure against the US for the first time ever if President Donald Trump uses tariffs to unfairly force the bloc into policy changes.
title: France Said to Float Using Most Powerful EU Trade Tool on US

description: President Donald Trump said that key functions of the Education Department, which he is moving to dramatically shrink, would be handled by the Small Business Administration and Department of Health and Human Services, amid worries that his efforts to overhaul the federal government could reduce some programs.
title: Trump Hands Student Loans, Disability Programs to Other Agencies

description: A long-simmering dispute between Sudan’s army and a paramilitary group exploded into a full-blown civil war in April 2023. At least 150,000 people may have been killed since then, according to US estimates, and the violence shows little sign of abating.
title: Sudan Ravaged by a Civil War the World Has Overlooked

description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul, who’s in a standoff with Donald Trump and his administration over congestion pricing, said she’s encouraged that her “direct pipeline” to the president will keep the system in place.
title: Hochul Sees Path Forward With Trump in NYC Congestion-Fee Spat

description: The Small Business Administration is preparing to cut 43% of its workforce, citing Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency as the impetus behind the employee terminations.
title: Small Business Administration to Cut 43% of Workers in DOGE Push

description: Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan warned the main opposition party that he won’t submit to “street terror” after it called for nationwide protests over Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu’s detention.
title: Turkey’s Erdogan Warns Opposition Over Calls for Mass Protests

description: Boeing Co. won a contract to design and build the US’s next-generation fighter jet, beating out rival Lockheed Martin Corp. for the multibillion dollar program.
title: Boeing Beats Lockheed for Next-Gen US Fighter Jet Contract

description: US President Donald Trump appeared to endorse the idea of joining the Commonwealth of Nations — the organization largely composed of former British colonies and run by King Charles III — in a social media post.
title: Trump Says Joining Commonwealth Nations ‘Sounds Good to Me’

description: The Trump administration is escalating its probe into federal consultancies, including Booz Allen Hamilton Holding Corp. and Accenture Plc, warning the firms they must explain what they do in plain language rather than “jargon or gobbledygook.”
title: Trump Official Demands No ‘Gobbledygook’ From US Consultant Firms

description: Democratic congressional candidates running in a pair of special elections in Florida raised millions more than their Republican counterparts, according to filings with the Federal Election Commission, highlighting how the races are galvanizing a party eager to chip away at the GOP’s narrow House majority.
title: Democrats Pour Money Into Florida Races to Erode GOP Majority

description: The United Arab Emirates will invest $1.4 trillion in the United States over 10 years following a meeting earlier this week between President Donald Trump and Sheikh Tahnoon Bin Zayed Al Nahyan, the UAE’s national security adviser, according to the White House.
title: UAE Pledges $1.4 Trillion US Investment After Trump Meeting

description: The US Department of State canceled a key meeting with executives from some of the country’s biggest companies, as well as labor advocates, academics and other experts, to discuss combating human rights abuses in global supply chains, citing President Donald Trump’s efforts to streamline the government.
title: State Department Calls Off Advisory Meeting on Child Labor

description: The move to use jail-like facilities to hold children comes as the administration also tries to roll back legal services offered to unaccompanied minors.
title: Trump Administration Aims to Bring Back Detention Centers for Immigrant Kids

description: A bipartisan pair of lawmakers is seeking sanctions relief for Syria as the country rebuilds after the fall of President Bashar al Assad.
title: Syria Sanctions Relief Sought by Bipartisan Pair of Lawmakers

description: From spurned civil servants to frustrated residents, a surge of Americans are considering running for office.
title: Former Federal Workers Find an Outlet in Local Elections

description: US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer is expected to hold his first phone call with his Chinese counterpart next week, people familiar with the plans said.
title: US Trade Chief Greer Set for China Counterpart Call Next Week

description: Three decades ago, Canada published a report about its future military plans. “The Cold War is over,” its first chapter began, before outlining the government’s massive budget pressures and proposing cuts to personnel and defense spending.
title: Canada Rushes to Fund Its Neglected Military After Trump Threats

description: Switzerland’s government rejected a proposal from the country’s largest political party to cap the population, diminishing the plan’s chances of passing in a national vote.
title: Swiss Government Rejects Population Cap, Fighting Largest Party

description: Israel will permanently annex land in Gaza if Hamas continues to refuse to free hostages, its defense minister said.
title: Israel Threatens to Annex Land in Gaza Unless Hostages Freed

description: Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah was sworn in as Namibia’s first female president as the southwest African nation prepares for an anticipated oil and gas boom.
title: On Verge of Oil Boom, Namibia Swears in First Female President

description: A sector-by-sector tariff approach by US President Donald Trump risks creating divisions among European Union member states, Ireland’s prime minister said.
title: Trump Tariffs Risk Splitting EU on Response, Irish Premier Says

description: Tunisia’s president fired his third prime minister in less than two years, deepening a political malaise in the North African country that’s struggling to revive its sluggish economy.
title: Tunisia’s President Fires Another Premier as Economy Languishes

description: AstraZeneca Plc will invest $2.5 billion in a new research center in Beijing, in a major show of commitment to China just months after the company’s top executive there was detained by authorities.
title: AstraZeneca Invests $2.5 Billion in Beijing Hub Amid Probe

description: Turkey’s main opposition party called for nationwide protests on Friday over the detention of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s most prominent rival.
title: Turkey’s Opposition Calls for Nationwide Protests on Friday

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The Trump Effect Reaches All the Way to Australia

description: Germany’s move to unlock hundreds of billions of euros in debt-financed defense and infrastructure spending passed its final legislative hurdle on Friday when lawmakers in the upper house of parliament in Berlin approved the measures.
title: Germany’s Landmark Spending Bill Wins Final Lawmaker Backing

description: On paper, it was one of the most lucrative victories ever in the field of litigation financing. Burford Capital Ltd., a niche firm, hit the jackpot along with other creditors when a judge delivered a $16.1 billion award on claims it acquired against the Argentine government for less than $17 million.
title: Burford Met With Silence From Milei Over $16 Billion Judgment

description: President Donald Trump said his first day in office marked the start of a “golden age” for the US. He and his advisers now say it could take months or longer to arrive.
title: Trump Promised an American Boom. He Now Says It May Take a While

description: Taiwan named a former head of the Japanese defense forces as an adviser, according to officials in the archipelago’s government, a move coming as the two governments deal with China’s increasing assertiveness.
title: Taiwan Names Japan’s Ex-Defense Chief as Cabinet Consultant

description: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda said the Baltic nation is prepared to deploy troops as part of a post-ceasefire mission to Ukraine as European allies grapple with how to maintain support for Kyiv.
title: Lithuania Willing to Commit Troops to Ukraine, President Says

description: Iran’s supreme leader reiterated a warning to the US and its allies that they won’t be able to force his country into negotiations through threats and vowed “harsh blows” against any American aggression.
title: Iran Rebuffs US Threats While Preparing Reply to Trump’s Letter

description: A pro-Beijing newspaper has called on CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. to pull out from an agreement to sell its ports on the Panama Canal to a group led by BlackRock Inc., marking an escalation of a pressure campaign on billionaire Li Ka-shing over the deal.
title: Pro-Beijing Paper Urges Li Ka-shing to Scrap Panama Port Sale

description: The Sudanese national army entered the presidential palace in Khartoum on Friday morning, Reuters reported, as the rebel Rapid Support Forces paramilitary group continues to lose ground in the capital.
title: Sudanese Army Enters Presidential Palace, Reuters Reports

description: The Turkish lira is on course for the largest weekly drop in nearly two years after the detention of a key opposition politician rattled investors.
title: Lira Set for Worst Weekly Drop Since 2023 Amid Turkey Turmoil

description: Bismuth — a niche metal used in industries from paints to defense — has rallied spectacularly since early February, when Beijing triggered export curbs in response to US President Donald Trump’s trade offensive.
title: A Critical Metal Jumps 500% After Xi Replies to Trump Tariffs

description: Germany’s new era of big spending is pulling up borrowing costs across Europe, reigniting jitters around fiscal stability on the continent’s periphery.
title: Germany’s Spending Plan Reignites Jitters Over Periphery Debt

description: Vietnam officials are investigating the Chinese milk tea brand Chagee, which is set to open its first store in Vietnam, for using images of the so-called “nine-dash line” map on its mobile app, according to a posting on the Ho Chi Minh City party committee’s website.
title: Vietnam Investigates Milk Tea Brand in Another Probe Over Map

description: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels captured a third major town in the Democratic Republic of Congo, expanding their stranglehold over the country’s mineral-rich east.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Expand Control of Congo Despite Ceasefire

description: For the full experience visit: Tracking Every Trump Tariff and Its Economic Effect
title: Tracking Every Trump Tariff and Its Economic Effect

description: The UK Parliament should press on with outlawing physical punishment.
title: Spare the Rod - Smacking Kids Should Be a Crime

description: The UK no longer wants to be a global antitrust crusader. Reform could see fewer deals get roasted. It’s good for bankers, middling for lawyers and worrying for consumers.
title: Brexit Britain Abandons Ambition to Be Global Deal Cop

description: Ammunition manufacturers are working to secure supplies of chemicals and cotton as they prepare for a massive increase in demand for explosives and propellants.
title: Europe Is Short of Gunpowder and TNT When It Needs Them Most

description: Germany’s move to unlock hundreds of billions of euros in debt-financed defense and infrastructure spending is expected to pass its final legislative hurdle on Friday when lawmakers in the upper house of parliament in Berlin vote on the measures.
title: German Landmark Spending Bill Faces Final Hurdle: What to Watch

description: Days before the fateful White House encounter between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy, Ukraine took a symbolic step on the path to regaining its financial footing when officials received a delegation of foreign investors in Kyiv.
title: Ukraine Seeks to Reconnect With Investors on Bumpy Path to Peace

description: A top security aide to Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Pyongyang for a meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un amid talk of a potential summit between the two leaders.
title: Putin’s Top Security Aide Arrives in North Korea for Kim Meeting

description: President Donald Trump has ordered federal agencies to share data across the government, part of his crusade to eliminate the waste and fraud that he says can be uncovered in many programs and departments.
title: Trump Order to Share US Data Focuses on Unemployment Information

description: Freddie Mac, one of the key government-backed housing finance entities, named its president, Mike Hutchins, as interim chief executive officer, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Freddie Mac Names Hutchins Interim CEO as Pulte Revamps Agencies

description: Elon Musk will be briefed on Friday about the US military’s contingency planning for any potential war with China, the New York Times reported, a move that would expose some of the Pentagon’s closest-guarded strategic thinking to a billionaire with extensive business ties in China.
title: Musk to See Secret US Contingency Plan for China War, NYT Says

description: The White House is poised to announce the winner on Friday of its contest to build the next-generation fighter jet, choosing between competing bids from US aerospace giants Lockheed Martin Corp. and Boeing Co., people familiar with the matter said.
title: White House Set to Announce Contractor for Next-Gen Fighter Jet

description: China plans to add to its strategic reserves of key industrial metals this year, an effort to boost the resilience of critical minerals supply at time when energy-transition demand is increasing and geopolitical tensions are running high.
title: China to Add Cobalt, Copper in Boost to State Metal Reserves

description: For months, President Prabowo Subianto’s moves to chip away at Indonesia’s long-established economic guardrails have stoked anxiety in markets. This week’s sudden rout suggests investor patience is wearing thin.
title: Prabowo Faces Investor Revolt Over Indonesia’s Economic Path
